p: The antimicrobial activity was determined by the paper disk diffusion method (100 μg compound in 8 mm paper disk), using meat peptone agar for Staphylococcus aureus and Pseudomonas aeruginosa. Comound 287 exhibited antibacterial activity against S. aureus and P. aeruginosa with MIC values (μg/mL) of >50 and 6.25. Chloramphenicol and kanamycin were used for positive control against S. aureus and P. aeruginosa (each 1 μg/mL), respectively [ 31].
